channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: China’s War for Indo-Pacific Dominance Is Already Underway
item.description: How far will we let China advance in its ongoing war in the Indo-Pacific, as we ‘prepare’ for war over Taiwan?

item.title: Trump Ousts Leftist Joint Chiefs Of Staff Chair, Other DEI-Pushing Military Officials
item.description: 'Under President Trump, we are putting in place new leadership that will focus our military on its core mission of deterring, fighting and winning war...

item.title: Now the AP Cares About Clarity in Language
item.description: And all it took was a fight with a Republican White House.

item.title: By Defending Free Speech Worldwide, Team Trump Reclaims America’s Global Moral High Ground
item.description: Under President Donald Trump, the suppression of natural rights by Western powers will no longer be ignored by the United States.

item.title: Popular conservative podcaster Dan Bongino named FBI deputy director
item.description: Dan Bongino, a former Secret Service agent, was named as the FBI's next deputy director.

item.title: The Administrative State Is So Corrupt It Makes The 19th Century’s Patronage System Look Good
item.description: The president should have the power to staff the executive branch with people he knows will not actively work against his policies.

item.title: FBI expected to transfer 1,500 staffers out of Washington area
item.description: The FBI is expected to transfer up to 1,500 of its personnel out of its Washington headquarters to field offices across the country, bureau managers l...

item.title: What Makes an American Impresario?
item.description: An interview with Lawrence ‘Larry’ Perelman, classical music adviser and friend of William F. Buckley Jr.

item.title: Spare Us Your Fake Modesty, Politicians
item.description: Aspiring officeholders increasingly disguise their obvious lust for power with a transparent sheen of public-spiritedness.

item.title: No, Choosing Family Over Career Isn’t ‘Settling For Less’
item.description: Women have been saddled with some version of the 'Don't settle' narrative for decades, and it's made them miserable.

item.title: A DOGE-Driven Overhaul Could Improve the Education Bureaucracy
item.description: Recent funding cuts to the Institute of Education Sciences are an opportunity to reimagine and rebuild the education R&D infrastructure America needs.

item.title: Bureaucracies 'cannibalizing our nation' lawmaker says, expressing empathy for federal workers facing job cuts
item.description: Rep. Clay Higgins expresses empathy for federal workers facing joblessness, but says bureaucracies have been "cannibalizing our nation."
